definitions.definition: To break or separate into pieces; to disintegrate or come apart.
definitions.example: It broke up when it hit the ground.
She broke up with her boyfriend last week.

definitions.definition: To end a relationship with each other.

definitions.example: The meeting finally broke up after a three-hour discussion.

definitions.definition: Of a school, to close for the holidays at the end of term.
Of a telephone conversation, to cease to be understandable because of a bad connection.
definitions.example: You're breaking up. Can you repeat that?

definitions.definition: To break or separate into pieces.
definitions.example: Break up the cheese and put it in the salad.

definitions.definition: To stop a fight; to separate people who are fighting.
definitions.example: The police came in to break up the disturbance.
